intro: Cephalaria lavandulacea, commonly known as lavenderleaf cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are aromatic, reminiscent of lavender, and its yellow flowers bloom in summer. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
